cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as concentric wheels, with material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: Cosmic Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively).

alternateConfigurations.name: Astral Above, Elemental Below
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below.

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane where all four elements churn in chaos; an Overheaven where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld where evil deities and Fiends reside.

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it.

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Abyss
planes.philosophicalEssence: Embodies all that is perverse, gruesome, and chaotic.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Loathsome corruption of chaos and evil. Temptation to turn against allies in order to survive.

temperature.description: Varies enormously by layer.

layers.name: The Plain of Infinite Portals
layers.description: On layer 1, corroded iron fortresses defend routes to lower layers under a glaring red sun. Rocky ground contains gaping craters that are portals to other layers.

notableLocations.name: Broken Reach
notableLocations.description: A fortress containing the portal to Plague-Mort, ruled by a succubus named Red Shroud. Those who prove their strength can stay unharmed for a few days.

layers.environmentalDescription: Under a glaring red sun, rocky ground contains gaping craters that are portals to other Abyss layers. Iron fortresses dot the landscape.

layers.name: Azzagrat
layers.description: Graz'zt's corrupt, decadent city is split across layers 45, 46, and 47. Markets and pleasure palaces draw visitors from across the multiverse.

notableLocations.name: Argent Palace
notableLocations.description: Graz'zt's seat of power in the city of Zelatar.

notableLocations.name: Zelatar
notableLocations.description: A bustling city with markets and pleasure palaces.

ruler.name: Graz'zt
ruler.title: Demon Lord
ruler.description: Embodies manipulation and cruelty, tempting mortals with appalling delights and decadent luxuries.

layers.environmentalDescription: A veneer of civility and courtly comity concealing danger. Mazelike cities and forests with serpent branches.

layers.name: The Demonweb
layers.description: Lolth's immense network of thick magical webbing forms passageways and cocoon-like chambers. Conceals random portals to demiplanes and Material Plane worlds.

notableLocations.name: Demonweb Pits
notableLocations.description: Bottomless pits where the Spider Queen dwells with her most loyal yochlol servants.

ruler.name: Lolth
ruler.title: Demon Queen of Spiders
ruler.description: Schemes entangle civilizations across the multiverse. Most active interest in worlds of the Material Plane.

layers.environmentalDescription: An immense network of thick magical webbing with structures, ships, and objects caught within.

layers.name: Gaping Maw
layers.description: Layer 88 is a malevolent wilderness surrounding Demogorgon's ocean fortress. A massive primeval continent covered in dense jungle surrounded by endless ocean and brine flats.

notableLocations.name: Abysm
notableLocations.description: Two serpentine towers topped with enormous fanged skulls emerging from a turbid sea. Echoes of Demogorgon's turbulent thoughts tear at the minds of creatures inside.

ruler.name: Demogorgon
ruler.title: Prince of Demons
ruler.description: The Sibilant Beast, a two-headed monster yearning for nothing less than undoing the order of the multiverse.

layers.environmentalDescription: Vast wilderness of brutality and horror where even powerful demons are overcome by fear.

layers.name: Thanatos
layers.description: An endless graveyard hosting Orcus and the sleepless dead. Bleak mountains, barren moors, ruined cities, and forests of twisted black trees under a black sky.

notableLocations.name: Everlost
notableLocations.description: A vast palace crafted of obsidian and bone, set in the wasteland of Oblivion's End.

notableLocations.name: Oblivion's End
notableLocations.description: A howling wasteland surrounding Everlost, with tombs and graves in tiered necropolis valleys.

ruler.name: Orcus
ruler.title: Demon Prince of Undeath
ruler.description: The Blood Lord, a brooding nihilistic entity who yearns to make the multiverse a place of death and despair under his control.

layers.environmentalDescription: Tombs, mausoleums, gravestones, and sarcophagi litter the landscape. Undead swarm across the plane.

layers.name: The Slime Pits
layers.description: A fetid realm of ooze and fungi obeying the whims of Juiblex and Zuggtmoy. A bubbling morass of fetid sludge with vast expanses of caustic slimes.

notableLocations.name: Zuggtmoy's Palace
notableLocations.description: Two dozen immense hollowed mushrooms forming grand chambers and twisting corridors, surrounded by acidic puffballs and poisonous vapors.

ruler.name: Juiblex
ruler.title: Demon Lord of Slimes and Oozes
ruler.description: The Faceless Lord, an amorphous mass lurking in abyssal depths.

layers.environmentalDescription: Bubbling morass of fetid sludge with strange organic forms rising from oceans of ooze.

layers.name: The Death Dells
layers.description: Yeenoghu and his gnoll servants prowl this cruel, desolate realm of ravines and badlands. Creatures must hunt to survive; even plants snare the unwary.

ruler.name: Yeenoghu
ruler.title: Gnoll Lord
ruler.description: Hungers for slaughter and senseless destruction. Drives gnolls to ever-greater atrocities.

layers.environmentalDescription: Ravines and badlands where creatures must hunt to survive. Plants try to snare the unwary.

layers.name: The Endless Maze
layers.description: An endless labyrinth with Baphomet's enormous palace at its center, surrounded by a mile-wide moat concealing submerged stairs and tunnels.

notableLocations.name: Baphomet's Palace
notableLocations.description: An enormous palace at the center of the Endless Maze, a confusing jumble of crooked hallways and myriad chambers surrounded by a mile-wide moat.

ruler.name: Baphomet
ruler.title: Horned King, Prince of Beasts
ruler.description: Embodies bestial bloodlust. Wishes civilization would crumble and all mortals embrace predatory instincts.

layers.environmentalDescription: A never-ending dungeon labyrinth.

hazards.name: Abyssal Corruption
hazards.description: The corruption of the Abyss affects visitors. Its virtually endless layers spiral downward into ever more appalling forms, each reflecting the entropic nature of the Abyss.
hazards.sourceReference: See 'Curses and Magical Contagions' in chapter 3

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx churns through the top layers of the Abyss.

notableEntities.name: Juiblex
notableEntities.title: Demon Lord of Slimes and Oozes

adventureThemes: Confronting evil within oneself
Resisting temptation to betray allies
Desperate last stands against demon hordes
Seeking holy relics in hostile territory
Contamination spreading to other planes

planes.name: Acheron
planes.philosophicalEssence: Enforced order, rigid conformity, crushed spirits and broken hopes. Unending conflict without purpose.

physicalProperties.shape: Immense iron blocks drifting through an airy void, sometimes colliding.

temperature.description: Varies by layer from metallic surfaces to icy mires.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Fearsome collisions of iron blocks send shudders through the plane.

layers.name: Avalas
layers.description: Spirit soldiers wage endless wars across debris-strewn battlefields on perfect iron cubes.
layers.environmentalDescription: Largest blocks gravitate here. Endless armies march across metallic surfaces.

layers.name: Thuldanin
layers.description: Pitted, hollow cubes filled with the cast-off machinery of war.
layers.environmentalDescription: A scrapyard of war machinery inside hollow iron cubes.

layers.name: Tintibulus
layers.description: Jagged blocks tumble in darkness, holding frozen memories sapped by the River Styx and crystallized into fleeting images.
layers.environmentalDescription: Dark tumbling blocks containing crystallized memories.

layers.name: Ocanthus
layers.description: Maelstroms of razor-sharp debris swirl above a mire of black ice. Tiny shards break off and are gradually assembled into the perfect cubes of Avalas.
layers.environmentalDescription: Razor-sharp debris and black ice mire. The origin point of Acheron's iron blocks.

hazards.name: Bloodlust of Acheron
hazards.description: The nature of Acheron instills bloodlust in those who visit the plane.

hazards.name: Block Collisions
hazards.description: Immense iron blocks sometimes collide with a fearsome clang, crushing all between them and sending shudders through the plane.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx churns through the top layers of Acheron.

adventureThemes: Confrontation with nihilism of unending conflict
Harsh reality of authoritarian rule
Pressures of social conformity
Finding what one fights for
Scavenging Thuldanin for horrors of warfare
Retrieving secrets from Tintibulus memories

planes.name: Arborea
planes.philosophicalEssence: A plane of extremes: violent moods, deep affections, whim backed by steel, passions that blaze brightly.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Charged with excitement. Emotional honesty where masks fall away. Creatures that leave may experience desperate yearning to return.

temperature.description: Warm sunlight filtering through forest canopy, sudden squalls that pass quickly.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Sudden squalls brew from nowhere with heavy winds, passing within minutes leaving warm flares of sunlight. Music always seems to be playing in the distance.

layers.name: Arvandor
layers.description: Towering trees, colorful wildflowers, abundant grain, and delicious fruit create a lush environment.
layers.environmentalDescription: Lush paradise of towering trees, colorful wildflowers, and abundant harvests.

layers.name: Aquallor
layers.description: An eternal ocean fed by the River Oceanus is home to teeming sea life and mighty storms.
layers.environmentalDescription: Eternal ocean with teeming sea life and mighty storms.

layers.name: Mithardir
layers.description: A desert of white sand abandoned by whatever powers once lived there.
layers.environmentalDescription: A mysterious silver desert of white sand with unknown secrets.

planarConnections.name: River Oceanus
planarConnections.description: The River Oceanus streams across the top layer of Arborea and drains away in the second layer.

adventureThemes: Discovering who you are when masks fall away
Emotional honesty and unfettered emotion
Hurt feelings and lingering resentment from unexpected candor
Exploring secrets of Mithardir's abandoned civilization

planes.name: Arcadia
planes.philosophicalEssence: Flawless existence where everything works toward the common good. Purity is eternal and nothing intrudes on harmony.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Suffused with vigorous life energy bestowing great vitality on visitors.

temperature.description: Perfect weather governed by the four Storm Kings.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Weather governed by four allied demigods: the Cloud King, the Wind Queen, the Lightning King, and the Rain Queen.

layers.name: Abellio
layers.description: Fields of plenty where everything is dedicated to the good of all. Orchards of perfectly lined trees, ruler-straight streams, orderly fields, immaculate roads.
layers.environmentalDescription: Geometric perfection in nature with ruler-straight streams and immaculate roads.

layers.name: Buxenus
layers.description: Military forces gather strength amid pleasant valleys and orchards to reclaim the lost layer of Menausus—now part of Mechanus.
layers.environmentalDescription: Pleasant valleys and orchards with military encampments.

timeFlow.description: Night and day determined by a floating orb. Half radiates sunlight for day, half sheds moonlight for night. Rotates evenly without fail.

hazards.name: Vigorous Life Energy
hazards.description: Arcadia is suffused with a vigorous life energy that bestows great vitality on visitors.

notableEntities.name: Cloud King
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four demigods governing Arcadia's weather.

notableEntities.name: Wind Queen
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four demigods governing Arcadia's weather.

notableEntities.name: Lightning King
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four demigods governing Arcadia's weather.

notableEntities.name: Rain Queen
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four demigods governing Arcadia's weather.

adventureThemes: Tension between individual freedom and societal responsibility
Conforming to social expectations versus personal identity

planes.name: Astral Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A realm of thought and dream where visitors travel as disembodied souls to reach the Outer Planes.

physicalProperties.shape: A great silvery sea with swirling wisps of white and gray.
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: No physical atmosphere needed; creatures exist as astral selves.

timeFlow.description: Creatures on the Astral Plane don't age or suffer from hunger or thirst.

hazards.name: Psychic Wind
hazards.description: A storm of thought that batters travelers' minds. Made of lost memories, forgotten ideas, and subconscious fears. Sensed as rapid darkening of the sky for 1d4 minutes before area becomes dark as moonless night.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Each traveler caught in a psychic wind makes a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw.

onFailure.description: Suffer a random psychic effect from the Psychic Wind Psychic Effects table.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A deep thrum in the ethereal matter sensed by creatures with Passive Perception 15+.

entries.description: At the end of the travel time, the characters arrive at a location other than the intended destination.

entries.effect: Sent through a random color pool
entries.description: Roll on the Astral Color Pools table.

entries.durationDescription: 1 minute; repeat save at end of each turn, ending on success.
5 (1d10) hours; ends if you take damage or another creature shakes you awake.

civilizations.name: Tu'narath
civilizations.description: A githyanki city built on the petrified remains of a dead god, perhaps the most infamous such outpost.
civilizations.location: Astral Plane, on a dead god's corpse

specialRules.name: Astral Movement
specialRules.description: A traveler in the Astral Plane can move by simply thinking about moving. In combat, a creature has a Fly Speed (in feet) equal to 5 times its Intelligence score and can hover.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Fly Speed = 5 × Intelligence score (feet), can hover. Outside combat, distance is meaningless and navigation is accomplished by thinking about the destination.

specialRules.name: No Aging or Biological Needs
specialRules.description: Creatures on the Astral Plane don't age or suffer from hunger or thirst.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: No aging. No hunger or thirst. Children must be raised on other planes to grow to maturity.

specialRules.name: Astral Navigation
specialRules.description: Thinking about a destination on the Astral Plane makes a creature aware of the most direct route. Travel to a specific location takes 4d6 days; to a general location takes 1d4 × 10 hours.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Think of destination to learn direction. Specific location: 4d6 days. General location: 1d4 × 10 hours.

adventureThemes: Journey to other planes
Encountering fellow travelers (Celestials, Fiends, slaadi, modrons, githyanki)
Plumbing crystallized thoughts of dead gods
Sifting information from psychic winds
Facing Astral manifestations of memories, fears, and dreams

crossReferences.description: Contains extensive information about Wildspace and Astral travel.

planes.name: Beastlands
planes.philosophicalEssence: Nature unbound. Embodies nature's wildness and beauty, the animal within all living creatures.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Visitors feel invigorated, more vital, minds more alert, reflexes sharpened, strides quickened. Hunger pangs acute but food tastes better. Sleep is always deep and restful.

temperature.description: Ranges from eternal summer noon to eternal twilight to eternal night across layers.

layers.name: Krigala
layers.description: The River Oceanus is a strong torrent flowing through this wilderness of eternal summer noon.
layers.environmentalDescription: Endless wilderness bathed in eternal summer noon light.

layers.name: Brux
layers.description: A red sun hovers forever on the horizon as mists and streams roil through the trees in eternal twilight.

lightLevel.naturalLightSource: Red sun hovering on the horizon

layers.environmentalDescription: Eternal twilight with mists and streams among trees.

layers.name: Karasuthra
layers.description: A pale moon provides the only light in this wilderness of eternal night.
layers.environmentalDescription: Wilderness of eternal night lit only by a pale moon.

planarConnections.name: River Oceanus
planarConnections.description: The River Oceanus passes through the top layer of the Beastlands.

specialRules.name: Beast Slaying Shapeshift
specialRules.description: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane, the slayer must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or shape-shift into the type of Beast that was slain.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: On failed DC 10 Charisma save: creature's game statistics replaced by Beast's stat block, retains alignment, personality, creature type, Intelligence score, and ability to speak. End of each Long Rest, repeat save; success returns to true form. After 3 failed saves, only Remove Curse or similar magic can undo.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane.

onFailure.description: Shape-shift into the type of Beast that was slain. Game statistics replaced by Beast's stat block, but retain alignment, personality, creature type, Intelligence score, and ability to speak.
onFailure.duration: Until successful save after Long Rest or 3 failures

onSuccess.description: No effect; the creature is not transformed.

adventureThemes: Exploring the value of physical life and the natural world
Conflict with those who dismiss animals as inferior
Vibrant power of life in the natural world

planes.name: Bytopia
planes.philosophicalEssence: Heaven of productive work, the satisfaction of a job well done. Personal achievement alongside social interdependence.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Feelings of goodwill and happiness. Dothion rewards quiet life; Shurrock rewards self-challenge.

physicalProperties.shape: Two layers facing each other like covers of a closed book, about a mile apart.

temperature.description: Dothion is pastoral and temperate; Shurrock has rough country and harsh weather.

layers.name: Dothion
layers.description: Farms nestled among well-tamed woods are hubs of pastoral activity and individual industry.
layers.environmentalDescription: Idealized pastoral world of farms and well-tamed woods.

layers.name: Shurrock
layers.description: Small communities thrive around quarries and mills amid rough country and harsh weather.
layers.environmentalDescription: Rugged communities of industry amid challenging terrain.

adventureThemes: Recognizing the impact of actions through mirrored reactions on the opposite layer
Equal and opposite consequences

planes.name: Carceri
planes.philosophicalEssence: The grim inspiration for all other prisons. A plane of desolation, despair, treachery, and backstabbing.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Despair, passions, poisons, and realm-shattering betrayals. Hatreds run deep and slow.

temperature.description: Ranges from fetid jungles to frigid oceans to black ice across layers.

layers.name: Orthrys
layers.description: The River Styx meanders through a layer of vast bogs and quicksand.
layers.environmentalDescription: Vast bogs and quicksand with the meandering River Styx.

layers.name: Cathrys
layers.description: The stench of decay hangs over fetid jungles and scarlet plains.

layers.name: Minethys
layers.description: Stinging sand blows in unending storms, hiding the ruins of the ancient city Payratheon.

notableLocations.name: Payratheon
notableLocations.description: Ruins of an ancient city hidden by unending sandstorms.

layers.name: Colothys
layers.description: Deep chasms cut between cruel mountains make foot travel nearly impossible.

layers.name: Porphatys
layers.description: Cold, acidic oceans are fed by constant black snow.

layers.name: Agathys
layers.description: Black ice streaked with red covers this frigid realm.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx meanders through Carceri. Passage is extremely dangerous and ferries out are both rare and expensive.

specialRules.name: Prison Plane
specialRules.description: No one can leave Carceri easily. Magical efforts to leave by any spell other than Wish simply fail. Portals and gates become one-way only. Secret passages exist but are hidden and well guarded.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: All spells to leave the plane except Wish automatically fail. Portals/gates become one-way (inbound only). River Styx passage is extremely dangerous with rare/expensive ferries.

blockedSpells: All spells that transport creatures off the plane

escapeMethods: Secret hidden passages guarded by traps and deadly monsters
Becoming stronger than whatever force imprisoned you
prisonRules.portalBehavior: Portals and gates that open onto the plane become one-way only.
prisonRules.escapeRequirement: Prisoners can escape only by becoming stronger than whatever force imprisoned them.

adventureThemes: Forces that keep characters trapped or imprisoned
Helping prisoners escape
Spiritual and psychological imprisonment
Breeding despair and betrayal preventing cooperation

planes.name: Demiplanes
planes.philosophicalEssence: Extradimensional spaces with their own physical laws, shaped by their creators' will.

notableEntities.name: Strahd von Zarovich
notableEntities.title: Vampire Lord of Barovia
notableEntities.description: Rules the demiplane of Barovia.

civilizations.name: Barovia
civilizations.description: A land existing entirely within a demiplane under the sway of vampire lord Strahd von Zarovich.

specialRules.name: Demiplane Access
specialRules.description: Plane Shift can carry travelers to a demiplane but the proper tuning fork frequency can be extremely hard to acquire. Gate is more reliable if the caster knows of the demiplane.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Plane Shift requires hard-to-acquire tuning fork frequency. Gate works if caster knows of the demiplane. Entry can be as simple as moving through a portal or wall of mist.

modifiedSpells.modification: Requires specific tuning fork frequency that is extremely hard to acquire.

adventureThemes: Exploring how characters would shape reality
Confronting distorted realities crafted by villains

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Air
planes.philosophicalEssence: Movement, animation, and inspiration. The breath of life, the winds of change.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Open air. Temperature mild except near para-elemental borders.

temperature.description: Mild in most areas; extreme near Para-elemental Planes of Ice and Ash.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Constant winds of varying strength. Storms range from thunderstorms to tornadoes and hurricanes. Rain and snow only near the Plane of Ice.

notableEntities.name: Wind Dukes of Aaqa
notableEntities.title: Rulers of Aaqa
notableEntities.description: Dedicated to law and good, maintaining vigilant watch against Elemental Evil. Served by aarakocra.

civilizations.name: Aaqa
civilizations.description: A shining domain of silver spires and verdant gardens atop a fertile earth mote, reachable only by following a particular sequence of flowing winds.
civilizations.location: Hidden realm in the Plane of Air

domainsOrRegions.name: Aaqa
domainsOrRegions.description: A shining domain of silver spires and verdant gardens atop a fertile earth mote. The Wind Dukes are dedicated to law and good.

domainsOrRegions.name: Labyrinth Winds
domainsOrRegions.description: A complex web of air streams, currents, and winds ranging from stiff breezes to howling gales. Even skilled flying creatures must navigate carefully.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mistral Reach
domainsOrRegions.description: Near the Para-elemental Plane of Ice. A region of frigid winds and driving snowstorms. Earth motes covered with snow and ice.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sirocco Straits
domainsOrRegions.description: Near the Para-elemental Plane of Ash. Hot, dry winds scour earth motes into barren chunks of rock.

adventureThemes: Breath of life and winds of change
Clearing fog of ignorance
Elemental Evil: destructive power, vengeance, laying claim to things wrongfully denied

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Earth
planes.philosophicalEssence: Stability, rigidity, stern resolve, and tradition. Opposition to almost everything air represents.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: No air surrounds the peaks of highest mountains. Air exists in vast caverns.

temperature.description: Ranges from normal cavern temperature to extreme heat near the Furnaces.

physicalProperties.shape: A chain of mountains rising higher than any mountain range on the Material Plane, honeycombed with vast caverns.

civilizations.name: City of Jewels
civilizations.description: Capital city of the dao in the Great Dismal Delve / Sevenfold Mazework. Every building made of precious stones and metals. Protected by a spell alerting the population if a visitor steals a single stone.

domainsOrRegions.name: City of Jewels
domainsOrRegions.description: Capital of the dao in the Great Dismal Delve. Buildings of precious stones and metals with gemstone-inlaid spires. Protected by anti-theft spell.

domainsOrRegions.name: Furnaces
domainsOrRegions.description: Mountains nearest the Para-elemental Plane of Magma. Lava seeps through caverns, air reeks of sulfur. Great forges and smelting furnaces.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mud Hills
domainsOrRegions.description: Abutting the Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. Landslides send cascades into bottomless swamp. The plane constantly regenerates the land.

adventureThemes: Stability and tradition versus destructive force
Elemental Evil: crushing venerable institutions with landslides, sinkholes, earthquakes

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Fire
planes.philosophicalEssence: Vibrancy, passion, and change. Light of inspiration, warmth of compassion, flame of desire.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Breathable but creatures must cover mouths and eyes to avoid stinging cinders.

temperature.description: Comparable to a hot desert on the Material Plane.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Fierce winds and thick ash. Cinder storms. Wind always blows, sometimes rising to hurricane force.

timeFlow.description: 24-hour cycle. Blazing sun ranges from white hot at noon to deep red at midnight.

hazards.name: Extreme Heat
hazards.description: The heat on the Plane of Fire is comparable to a hot desert on the Material Plane and poses a similar threat to travelers. Sources of water are rare.

hazards.name: Cinder Storms
hazards.description: Thick ash obscures sight and stinging cinders require covering mouths and eyes.

notableEntities.name: Torchy
notableEntities.title: Proprietor of Torchy's tavern
notableEntities.description: A sentient Flame Tongue (Mace) who runs a tavern atop a basalt crag. Sells fine ale and seems to have a new wielder every few months.

civilizations.name: City of Brass
civilizations.description: Fabled city of the efreet on the shores of the Sea of Fire. Ornate spires and spiked walls. At its heart is the Charcoal Palace where the tyrannical emperor reigns. If possible to buy magic items in a campaign, the City of Brass is the most likely place to find any item for sale.
civilizations.location: Shores of the Sea of Fire

domainsOrRegions.name: Cinder Wastes
domainsOrRegions.description: Great expanse of black cinders and embers crossed by rivers of lava. Roving bands of salamanders, obsidian ruins of forgotten civilizations.

domainsOrRegions.name: City of Brass
domainsOrRegions.description: Fabled efreeti city. Ornate spires, spiked walls, dancing flames. The Charcoal Palace at its heart. A center of trade where magic items might be purchased. Efreet trade in favors.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Fire
domainsOrRegions.description: Great expanse of lava traversed by efreeti and azer sailors in brass ships. Islands of obsidian and basalt with ruins and red dragon lairs.

domainsOrRegions.name: Torchy's
domainsOrRegions.description: An iron-walled tavern built atop a tall basalt crag in a lava river, reached by hot-air balloon. Run by a sentient Flame Tongue (Mace).

adventureThemes: Vibrancy, passion, and change
Quests for legendary magic in City of Brass
Trading in favors with efreet
Elemental Evil: burning away impurities with volcanic eruptions and wildfires

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Water
planes.philosophicalEssence: The rhythm of the tide, nectar of life, bitter tears of mourning, balm of sympathy and healing. Given time, erodes all.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Endless sea. Air breathers need islands or ships. Land is hotly contested.

temperature.description: Warm sun with extremes of weather. Ranges from warm seas to frigid Sea of Ice.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Extremes: calm or battered by storms. Several times a day sky clouds over with rain and lightning. Rare rogue waves from planar tremors.

timeFlow.description: A warm sun arcs across the sky on a day/night cycle. Stars and auroras at night.

civilizations.name: Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls
civilizations.description: Opulent palace of coral studded with pearls, home of the nominal emperor of the marids. Visitors welcome to ask favors.

domainsOrRegions.name: Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls
domainsOrRegions.description: Opulent coral palace studded with pearls, home of the marid emperor. Visitors welcome.

domainsOrRegions.name: Darkened Depths
domainsOrRegions.description: Deeper extents with no sunlight. Absolute cold and crushing pressure. Home of krakens and mighty leviathans.

domainsOrRegions.name: Isle of Dread
domainsOrRegions.description: An island connected to the Material Plane by regular storms. Settlements populated by descendants of shipwrecked sailors.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Ice
domainsOrRegions.description: Bordering the Para-elemental Plane of Ice. Frigid water choked with icebergs and sheet ice.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Light
domainsOrRegions.description: Sunlit upper reaches with flourishing life. Aquatic peoples craft castles in coral reefs.

domainsOrRegions.name: Silt Flats
domainsOrRegions.description: Near the Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. Water thick with soil and sludge turning to muddy ground.

adventureThemes: Erosive power of water
Destruction by surging tides and maelstroms
Elemental Evil: seas eager to reclaim water trapped in living bodies

planes.name: Elysium
planes.philosophicalEssence: Embodiment of goodness. Unfettered kindness and a refuge for planar travelers.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Tranquility and contentment seep into bones and souls. The longer a visitor remains, the less reason they find to leave.

layers.name: Amoria
layers.description: Small towns on the banks of the River Oceanus, surrounded by lush meadows, are among the most hospitable refuges on the Outer Planes.

layers.name: Eronia
layers.description: Steep hills, craggy mountains, and white granite valleys offer a rugged home for hardy souls.

layers.name: Belierin
layers.description: Lighthouses pierce the fog and form hubs for small communities amid sprawling marshlands. Said to be a prison for some deadly creature.

layers.name: Thalasia
layers.description: The Heroic Isles, rising from the headwaters of the River Oceanus, hold the best departed souls.

notableLocations.name: Heroic Isles
notableLocations.description: Islands rising from the headwaters of the River Oceanus, holding the best departed souls.

planarConnections.name: River Oceanus
planarConnections.description: The River Oceanus originates in Thalasia (layer 4) and flows through all of Elysium's layers before cascading to the Beastlands.

adventureThemes: Temptation to rest from labors and enjoy reward
Proving devotion to doing good
Seeking ancient spirits on the Heroic Isles
Investigating the imprisoned creature of Belierin

planes.name: Ethereal Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A misty dimension overlapping material realms and providing passage to the Inner Planes.

timeFlow.description: In the Deep Ethereal, it's impossible to measure speed and hard to track passage of time. A trip takes 1d10 × 10 hours regardless of origin and destination.

hazards.name: Ether Cyclone
hazards.description: A serpentine column spinning through the plane, distorting and uprooting everything in its path. Travelers with Passive Perception 15+ receive 1 minute warning as a deep thrum.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A deep thrum in the ethereal matter.

entries.description: Each character makes DC 15 Charisma saving throw. If at least half succeed, travel delayed by 1d10 hours. Otherwise journey's travel time is doubled.
Blown to a random location in the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane (roll on Ethereal Curtains table).
Hurled to a random destination on the Astral Plane.

civilizations.name: Radiant Citadel
civilizations.description: A living relic of 27 great civilizations. A floating city carved from a single massive fossil around the Auroral Diamond. A nexus of diplomacy, trade, and sanctuary.

specialRules.name: Border Ethereal Properties
specialRules.description: From the Border Ethereal, travelers see into the overlapped plane but grayish and indistinct, limiting visibility to 30 feet into the other plane. Travelers are imperceptible to those on the overlapped plane. Solid objects on the overlapped plane don't hamper movement. Exceptions: magical effects (including magical force) and living beings.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Visibility into overlapped plane: 30 feet. Visibility in Border Ethereal: 60 feet. Creatures are imperceptible. Solid non-magical objects don't block movement. Creatures can't attack across the boundary normally.

specialRules.name: Deep Ethereal Travel Time
specialRules.description: Travel through the Deep Ethereal takes 1d10 × 10 hours from one curtain to another, regardless of origin and destination. In combat, creatures move at normal speeds.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Travel time: 1d10 × 10 hours between any two curtains. Combat movement at normal speeds.

domainsOrRegions.name: Border Ethereal
domainsOrRegions.description: The shores of the Ethereal Plane that overlap the Material Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, and Inner Planes. Visibility limited to 60 feet.

domainsOrRegions.name: Deep Ethereal
domainsOrRegions.description: Region of swirling mist and fog. Visibility limited to 30 feet. Contains colored curtains leading to Border Ethereal regions.

domainsOrRegions.name: Radiant Citadel

ruler.name: Collective governance
ruler.description: Power and resources equitably shared by common agreement.

domainsOrRegions.description: A floating city carved from a single massive fossil around the Auroral Diamond. Nexus of diplomacy and trade. Orbited by 15 Concord Jewels providing transport to founding civilizations.

adventureThemes: Traveling between planes
Scouting and spying without detection
Exploring the Radiant Citadel as a home base

crossReferences.description: Anthology of short adventures featuring the Radiant Citadel as a home base.

planes.name: Far Realm
planes.philosophicalEssence: Outside the known multiverse. Might be an entirely separate universe with its own physical and magical laws.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Too alien for mortal minds to accept without strain. Entities beyond comprehension. Knowledge is a struggle to overcome boundaries of matter, space, and rational thought.
adventureThemes: What it means to be a person
Mental and bodily autonomy
Whether mortals have control over fate
Confronting entities beyond comprehension
Investigating influence seeping into Material Plane

planes.name: Feywild
planes.philosophicalEssence: A land of soft lights and wonder, music and magic. Responds to unfettered emotion. Gives physical expression to powerful emotion and excels at metaphor.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The plane responds to unfettered emotion. Flowers turn in heated arguments, grass withers under malice, birds chirp for joy.

temperature.description: Varies by Domain of Delight and emotional state of rulers.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Variable; responsive to emotion and archfey will.

warpTable.effectDescription: Time passes much faster outside; days spent in Feywild equal only minutes elsewhere.
Time passes somewhat faster outside; days in Feywild equal hours elsewhere.
Time passes slower outside; days in Feywild equal weeks elsewhere.
Time passes much slower outside; days in Feywild equal months elsewhere.
Time passes extremely slowly outside; days in Feywild equal years elsewhere.

timeFlow.description: Time and distance are mutable. A Wish spell can remove the time warp effect on up to ten creatures.

environmentalEffects.name: Memory Loss
environmentalEffects.description: A creature that leaves the Feywild makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On failure, remembers nothing from time in the Feywild. On success, memories remain intact but hazy.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: DC 10 Wisdom save on leaving. Fail = no memories. Success = hazy memories. Any spell that ends a curse restores lost memories.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: When a creature leaves the Feywild.

onFailure.description: The creature remembers nothing from its time spent in the Feywild.

onSuccess.description: The creature's memories remain intact but are a little hazy.

recoveryMethods: Any spell that can end a curse

environmentalEffects.name: Time Warp
environmentalEffects.description: Characters who spend at least 1 day in the Feywild may find that less or more time has elapsed elsewhere. DM chooses or rolls on the Feywild Time Warp table (d20).
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Roll d20 on Feywild Time Warp table when leaving after 1+ days. A Wish spell can remove the effect on up to 10 creatures. Powerful Fey can grant such wishes in exchange for a Geas spell and quest.

notableEntities.name: Queen Titania
notableEntities.title: Ruler of the Summer Court
notableEntities.description: Rules the most settled and pastoral domain in the Feywild.

notableEntities.name: Queen of Air and Darkness
notableEntities.title: Ruler of the Gloaming Court
notableEntities.description: Rules a realm of twilight, fireflies, cobwebs, and autumn leaves.

notableEntities.name: Yarnspinner
notableEntities.title: Archfey of Fablerise
notableEntities.description: A story-spinning spider archfey who loves reading stories to animals.

notableEntities.name: Zybilna
notableEntities.title: Archfey of Prismeer
notableEntities.description: Regarded on some worlds as a fairy godmother. Grants wishes for the lost, forsaken, or betrayed.

domainsOrRegions.name: Fablerise
domainsOrRegions.description: A rambling thicket of twisted roots, thorny vines, and sinuous creepers woven into tunnels, hallways, and domes.

domainsOrRegions.name: Gloaming Court
domainsOrRegions.description: A realm of twilight, fireflies, cobwebs, and autumn leaves with music of hooting owls and croaking frogs. Prizing intuitive, instinctual behavior.

domainsOrRegions.name: Prismeer
domainsOrRegions.description: A large domain encompassing the swamp Hither, the forest Thither, and the mountainous Yon. The Palace of Heart's Desire stands where the three meet.

domainsOrRegions.name: Summer Court
domainsOrRegions.description: The most settled and pastoral domain, wrapped in perpetual summer warmth with butterflies and colorful flowers. Values elaborate ceremony and ritualized etiquette.

adventureThemes: Stolen memories or emotions given physical form
Mischievous Fey stealing abstract concepts
Navigating mutable geography
Time displacement

crossReferences.description: Prismeer is detailed in this adventure.

planes.name: Gehenna
planes.philosophicalEssence: Suspicion and greed with no space for mercy or compassion.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Suspicion so pervasive visitors can trust no one—perhaps not even each other.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Noxious fumes and searing flames from volcanic fissures.

temperature.description: Ranges from volcanic heat to freezing across layers.

layers.name: Khalas
layers.description: Lava illuminates clouds of volcanic ash and steam from the River Styx.

notableLocations.name: Teardrop Palace
notableLocations.description: A bustling market crowded with Fiends and mortal visitors offering forbidden and sinister goods. Named for its shape: the point diverts lava flow to either side.

layers.name: Chamada
layers.description: Constant lava flows and eruptions make overland travel difficult. Iron zeppelins piloted by yugoloths drift through constant gray ashfall.

notableLocations.name: Tower Arcane
notableLocations.description: A sinister structure adorned with blades and spikes, guarded by arcanaloths. Rumored to hold yugoloths' history and contract records.

layers.name: Mungoth
layers.description: Acidic ash mingles with falling snow on this freezing layer.

layers.name: Krangath
layers.description: A great mountain suspended in silence and darkness, home to a coterie of liches.

notableLocations.name: Dead Furnace
notableLocations.description: A great mountain suspended in silence and darkness.

hazards.name: Suspicion of Gehenna
hazards.description: The plane breeds suspicion and greed in visitors.

hazards.name: Extreme Inclines
hazards.description: The ground inclines at least 45 degrees almost everywhere. Steep cliffs and deep canyons present challenges. Volcanic fissures vent noxious fumes or searing flames.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx churns through the top layers of Gehenna.

adventureThemes: Betrayal and trust under pressure
Yugoloths in disguise testing empathy versus suspicion
Purchasing forbidden goods at the Teardrop Palace
Infiltrating the Tower Arcane for yugoloth secrets

planes.name: Hades
planes.philosophicalEssence: Places without joy, hope, or passion. Despair manifested as apathy. Pure undiluted evil as inescapable gravity of spirit.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Leaches away color and emotion. Slowly kills dreams, desires, hope, and optimism.

layers.name: Oinos
layers.description: A land of dead-gray ash, stunted trees, and virulent disease, stalked by roving bands of Fiends looking for a fight or recruits for the Blood War.

layers.name: Niflheim
layers.description: Gray pine trees blanket rolling hills and rocky bluffs, and thick mists coil around their trunks.

layers.name: Pluton
layers.description: Shriveled willows, olive trees, and poplars contribute to the gloom—the concentration of the deepest despair in the multiverse.

hazards.name: Plane of Gloom
hazards.description: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane, a visitor makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while in Hades. At 6 Exhaustion levels, the creature permanently transforms into a Larva instead of dying, and all Exhaustion levels are removed.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane.

onFailure.description: The creature gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while the creature is in Hades.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds 1 Exhaustion level. At 6 levels, permanent transformation occurs.
onFailure.terminalEffect: Permanently transforms into a Larva. All Exhaustion levels removed.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx flows through Hades.

adventureThemes: Finding answers to 'why bother?' amid overwhelming despair
Rekindling passion and purpose
Pursuing hags, liches, or evil spellcasters collecting larvae
Risk of being trapped by overwhelming despair

planes.name: Limbo
planes.philosophicalEssence: Pure chaos. Constant churn of elements applies equally on mental and emotional levels. The key to success is asserting one's sense of self.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Storm of intrusive thoughts and unruly emotions forcing confrontation with the transient nature of identity.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Atmosphere exists but is chaotically shifting.

temperature.description: Constantly shifting between all extremes.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Matter and energy in constant flux: stone melts to water, freezes to metal, turns to diamond, burns to smoke, becomes snow.

notableEntities.name: Primus
notableEntities.title: Overlord of the Modrons
notableEntities.description: Said to have created the Spawning Stone.

civilizations.name: Githzerai Monasteries
civilizations.description: Githzerai build entire monasteries with their minds, creating enclaves of order in the chaos.

specialRules.name: No Gravity
specialRules.description: Limbo has no gravity, so creatures float in place. A creature can move up to its Speed in any direction by merely thinking of the desired direction.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: No gravity. Creatures float. Movement up to Speed in any direction by thought.

specialRules.name: Move Object
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make an Intelligence check to mentally move an object within 30 feet that isn't worn or carried. DC by size: Tiny 5, Small 10, Medium 15, Large 20, Huge+ 25. On success, move the object 5 feet plus excess over DC.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. Intelligence check. DC varies by size. Success: move object 5 + (total - DC) feet.

interactionCheck.name: Limbo Object Movement
interactionCheck.description: Mentally move an unattended object within 30 feet.

onSuccess.description: Move the object 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to how much the total exceeded the DC.

specialRules.name: Alter Object
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make an Intelligence check to alter a nonmagical object within 30 feet that isn't worn or carried. DC by size: Tiny 10, Small 15, Medium 20, Large+ 25. On success, change the object into another nonliving form of the same size.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. Intelligence check. DC varies by size. Success: change into another nonliving form of same size.

interactionCheck.name: Limbo Object Alteration
interactionCheck.description: Change a nonmagical unattended object within 30 feet into another nonliving form of the same size.

onSuccess.description: The creature changes the object into another nonliving form of the same size, such as turning a boulder into a ball of fire.
onSuccess.transformationConstraints: Must be nonliving form of the same size.

specialRules.name: Stabilize Area
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make a DC 20 Intelligence check to stabilize an area within a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point it can see. On success, prevents the area from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this action again.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. DC 20 Intelligence check. Success: 30-foot-radius Sphere is stabilized for 24 hours or until the creature uses this action again.

interactionCheck.name: Limbo Area Stabilization
interactionCheck.description: Stabilize a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on a visible point, preventing planar alteration.

onSuccess.description: The area is prevented from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this Magic action again.

domainsOrRegions.name: Spawning Stone
domainsOrRegions.description: Said to have been created by Primus, the Spawning Stone absorbs chaotic energy, makes it possible to shape enclaves of order, but the absorbed chaotic energy is responsible for the creation of slaadi.

adventureThemes: Asserting sense of self amid constant change
Confronting transient nature of identity
Mastering internal chaos
Exploring githzerai sanctuaries
Investigating the Spawning Stone

planes.name: Material Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Where philosophical and elemental forces collide in the jumbled existence of mortal life and matter. A thoroughly magical place.

temperature.description: Infinitely diverse across worlds.

notableEntities.name: Corellon
notableEntities.title: God
notableEntities.description: Planted and tended a seedling of Yggdrasil on the First World. When the First World was destroyed, seeds scattered to form the worlds of the Material Plane.

adventureThemes: Infinite diversity of mortal worlds
Transit between worlds via Wildspace, Feywild, Shadowfell, or nexus points

planes.name: Mechanus
planes.philosophicalEssence: Perfectly regimented order. Equal measures of light and dark, heat and cold. Law reflected in gigantic interlocking clockwork gears.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Individual consciousness subordinated to the search for perfect order. 'I' subsumed into 'we'.

physicalProperties.shape: Gigantic clockwork gears interlocked and turning. Each cog has its own gravity pulling toward its center.

temperature.description: Equal proportions of heat and cold.

notableEntities.name: Primus
notableEntities.title: Overlord of the Modrons
notableEntities.description: The godlike creator of the modrons. Realm is called Regulus.

civilizations.name: Regulus
civilizations.description: Realm of Primus and home of the modrons who maintain the intricate clockworks.

adventureThemes: Examining individual ego versus adventuring party
Setting aside personal goals for greater cause
Asserting individual identity against collectivism

planes.name: Mount Celestia
planes.philosophicalEssence: The model of justice and order, celestial grace and endless mercy. Only the purest souls can reach the highest peak.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Pervasive goodness bestows blessings on creatures.

physicalProperties.shape: A mountain rising from a shining Silver Sea to utterly incomprehensible heights with seven plateaus.

temperature.description: Ranges from the Silver Sea to snowy slopes to glittering heavens.

layers.name: Lunia
layers.description: The holy water of the Silver Sea laps at the base of the celestial mountain under a starry sky.

layers.name: Mercuria
layers.description: Tame slopes and lush valleys bathed in golden light evoking the hope of a new dawn.

layers.name: Venya
layers.description: Terraced fields and tended woodlands dot the snowy slopes.

layers.name: Solania
layers.description: Holy shrines glitter under a silvery sky amid luminescent fog.

layers.name: Mertion
layers.description: On the sweeping plains, holy soldiers muster in grand citadels for battles across the planes.

notableLocations.name: Empyrea
notableLocations.description: A city on the edge of a clear lake, renowned for the healing power of its fountains and springs. Pilgrims from across the planes seek its healers, hospitals, and restorative magic.

layers.name: Jovar
layers.description: Strewn with beautiful rubies and garnets, home to the seven-tiered Heavenly City.

notableLocations.name: Heavenly City
notableLocations.description: A seven-tiered city among the rubies and garnets of Jovar.

layers.name: Chronias
layers.description: An ineffable mystery.

hazards.name: Blessings of Mount Celestia
hazards.description: The pervasive goodness of Mount Celestia bestows blessings on creatures on the plane.

adventureThemes: Proving worthiness of blessings
Forswearing selfishness, greed, and hatred
Defending against Fiend assaults
Evil's true foothold in hearts of well-meaning visitors
Healing pilgrimage to Empyrea

planes.name: Negative Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Source of necrotic energy that destroys the living and animates the Undead. A needy, greedy plane sucking the life out of everything.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: A lightless void without end. Only creatures with Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive long.

temperature.description: Heat, fire, and life are all drawn away.

hazards.name: Life Draining Environment
hazards.description: Merely entering the plane is comparable to the life-draining touch of a wraith. Only creatures with Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive for long.

hazards.name: Voidstones
hazards.description: In some locations, negative energy folds in on itself, stabilizing into solid chunks that devour light. Anything that comes into contact is destroyed in seconds. Thought to be the source of Spheres of Annihilation.

adventureThemes: Face-to-face confrontation with annihilation
Apathy and despair of Hades and Shadowfell combined and concentrated

planes.name: Nine Hells
planes.philosophicalEssence: The ultimate plane of law and evil, epitome of premeditated cruelty. Devils are bound to obey laws of superiors but squabble within castes.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Insidious manipulation, deceit, and treachery. Temptation to have deepest longings fulfilled.

temperature.description: Ranges from wasteland (Avernus) to volcanic (Phlegethos) to freezing (Stygia, Cania).

layers.name: Avernus
layers.description: The Blood War rages across battlefields littered with corpses and wreckage. A rocky wasteland with rivers of blood and clouds of biting flies under a darkened sky.

ruler.name: Zariel
ruler.title: Archdevil of Avernus
ruler.description: Appears as an angel with scorched skin and wings. Eyes burn with furious white light. Rules from a flying basalt citadel.

layers.environmentalDescription: Rocky wasteland with rivers of blood, fiery comets, biting flies, and empty battlefields.

layers.name: Dis
layers.description: Iron roads in deep canyons lead to the dreaded Iron City of Dis. A labyrinth of canyons between sheer iron-ore mountains.

notableLocations.name: Iron City of Dis
notableLocations.description: A hideous metropolis where planar travelers conspire with devils and close deals with night hags, rakshasas, and other Fiends.

ruler.name: Dispater
ruler.title: Archduke of Dis
ruler.description: A manipulator and deceiver, devilishly handsome with small horns, tail, and cloven left hoof. One of Asmodeus's most loyal vassals.

layers.name: Minauros
layers.description: Acid falls like rain on putrid bogs and decaying cities. Yawning pits lie beneath the murk.

notableLocations.name: City of Minauros
notableLocations.description: A cyclopean city with slimy walls rising hundreds of feet, concealing flooded halls piled with treasure.

ruler.name: Mammon
ruler.title: Archduke of Minauros
ruler.description: Resembles a massive serpent with humanoid upper torso. Legendary greed; one of few archdevils who trades favors for gold instead of souls.

layers.name: Phlegethos
layers.description: Obsidian fortresses bask in heat of raging volcanoes and magma rivers. Seas of molten magma brew hurricanes of hot wind.

notableLocations.name: Abriymoch
notableLocations.description: A fortress city of obsidian and dark glass within the caldera of the largest volcano, with rivers of lava pouring down its outer walls.

ruler.name: Belial
ruler.title: Archduke of Phlegethos
ruler.description: Rules in tandem with his daughter Fierna. Exudes civility with undercurrent of threat.

layers.name: Stygia
layers.description: Levistus's prison is a frigid hellscape of jagged ice and cold fire. A frozen sea under a gloomy, lightning-cracking sky.

ruler.name: Levistus
ruler.title: Archduke of Stygia
ruler.description: Once betrayed Asmodeus; now encased deep in ice as punishment. Rules telepathically from within his frozen prison.

layers.name: Malbolge
layers.description: An ever-crumbling mountain—a seemingly endless slope. Parts break off creating deadly avalanches. Inhabitants live in crumbling fortresses and caves.

notableLocations.name: Osseia
notableLocations.description: Glasya's citadel supported by cracked pillars, with a labyrinth of cells and torture chambers beneath.

ruler.name: Glasya
ruler.title: Archduchess of Malbolge
ruler.description: Asmodeus's daughter. Her cruelty and love of wicked schemes rival those of her father.

layers.name: Maladomini
layers.description: Swarms of hungry flies plague dead cities surrounded by utter desolation. Ruins, empty quarries, crumbling roads.

ruler.name: Baalzebul
ruler.title: Lord of Flies, Archduke of Maladomini
ruler.description: Tall, powerful devil with compound eyes of a fly. Has long conspired to usurp Asmodeus. Cursed so any deal leads to calamity.

layers.name: Cania
layers.description: Ice-trapped cities provide shelter in a realm cold enough to freeze the soul. Ice storms can tear flesh from bone.

notableLocations.name: Mephistar
notableLocations.description: Ice citadel where Mephistopheles plots to seize the throne of the Nine Hells.

ruler.name: Mephistopheles
ruler.title: Archduke of Cania
ruler.description: Brilliant and conniving. Asmodeus's greatest enemy and ally. Tall, striking devil with impressive horns and cool demeanor.

layers.name: Nessus
layers.description: Mighty fortresses stand watch over the deepest pits. A realm of dark pits with bleak fortresses and the great citadel-spire of Malsheem.

notableLocations.name: Malsheem
notableLocations.description: A gigantic hollowed-out stalagmite citadel-spire rising from a vast rift. Home to Asmodeus and his infernal court. Also a prison for souls Asmodeus has locked away.

ruler.name: Asmodeus
ruler.title: Archduke of Nessus, Supreme Ruler of the Nine Hells
ruler.description: Most cunning and well-mannered of archdevils. Appears as a handsome bearded man with four large horns, piercing red eyes, and flowing robes. Wields the power of a lesser god.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx winds through every layer of the Nine Hells, allowing passage from one layer to the next.

notableEntities.name: Asmodeus
notableEntities.title: Archduke of Nessus
notableEntities.description: Supreme ruler of all devils. Wields power of a lesser god. A supreme tyrant, brilliant deceiver, master of subtlety.

notableEntities.name: Tiamat
notableEntities.title: Queen of Evil Dragons
notableEntities.description: A prisoner on Avernus, ruling her own domain but confined by Asmodeus.

specialRules.name: No Direct Portals to Lower Layers
specialRules.description: By Asmodeus's orders, no planar portals connect directly to the lower layers of the Nine Hells. Avernus is the arrival point for all visitors.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: All visitors must arrive on Avernus (layer 1). To reach Nessus, one must descend through all eight layers above it.

adventureThemes: Journey into the heart of evil
Resisting insidious manipulation, deceit, and treachery
Temptation and corruption
Devils promising to fulfill deepest longings
The Blood War

planes.name: Outlands
planes.philosophicalEssence: The plane of neutrality, keeping all aspects of the planes in paradoxical balance—simultaneously concordant and in opposition.

physicalProperties.shape: A great disk. Sixteen gate-towns evenly spaced around outside edge. The Spire at the center.

temperature.description: Varied terrain with prairies, mountains, and shallow rivers.

notableEntities.name: Lady of Pain
notableEntities.title: Ruler of Sigil
notableEntities.description: An inscrutable being whose purpose and goals are unknown. Appears almost human with ornate robes and a mantle of blades with blue-green verdigris around a masklike face. A being on par with deities.

domainsOrRegions.name: Automata
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Mechanus.

domainsOrRegions.name: Bedlam
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Pandemonium.

domainsOrRegions.name: Curst
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Carceri.

domainsOrRegions.name: Ecstasy
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Elysium.

domainsOrRegions.name: Excelsior
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Mount Celestia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Faunel
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Beastlands.

domainsOrRegions.name: Fortitude
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Arcadia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Glorium
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Ysgard.

domainsOrRegions.name: Hopeless
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Hades.

domainsOrRegions.name: Plague-Mort
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to the Abyss.

domainsOrRegions.name: Ribcage
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Nine Hells.

domainsOrRegions.name: Rigus
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Acheron.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sylvania
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Arborea.

domainsOrRegions.name: Torch
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Gehenna.

domainsOrRegions.name: Tradegate
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Bytopia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Xaos
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Limbo.

adventureThemes: Conflicts between opposing planar influences
Celestial spies and Fiend assassins carrying out plots
Preserving nature's balance from powerful extremes

crossReferences.description: Includes extensive information on the Outlands.

planes.name: Pandemonium
planes.philosophicalEssence: Overwhelming chaos. A great mass of rock riddled with tunnels carved by howling winds. The plane of last straws.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Brings everyone to the edge of frustration, despair, or incoherence—then pushes them over.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Cold, noisy, dark. No natural light. Wind extinguishes nonmagical open flames.

layers.name: Pandesmos
layers.description: Howling winds, dark streams bound for the River Styx, and blowing snow pour through vast, desolate caverns.

layers.name: Cocytus
layers.description: Winds blowing through narrower tunnels create stronger force and louder wails.

notableLocations.name: Howler's Crag
notableLocations.description: A jagged spike rumored to have a unique magical property: anything yelled from the top finds the ears of its intended recipient anywhere in the multiverse, carried on a shrieking, frigid wind.

layers.name: Phlegethon
layers.description: Tunnel walls absorb light while water creates intricate rock formations.

layers.name: Agathion
layers.description: Sealed-off tunnels largely inaccessible from elsewhere, making them ideal as vaults for ancient secrets.

hazards.name: Howling Winds of Pandemonium
hazards.description: Cold, noisy, and dark with no natural light. Wind extinguishes nonmagical open flames (torches, campfires). Conversation only possible by yelling to a maximum distance of 10 feet.

effectOnConversation.reason: Howling winds drown out all other sound.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx churns through the top layers of Pandemonium.

adventureThemes: What happens on characters' worst day when everything goes wrong
Frustration without transferring it to players
Howler's Crag as message delivery mechanism

planes.name: Plane of Ash
planes.philosophicalEssence: Movement and change given a destructive tone by raging conflagration.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Thick ash obscures sight beyond a few dozen feet. Howling winds and battering travel.

adventureThemes: Commonality of air and fire: movement and change
Destructive conflagration

planes.name: Plane of Ice
planes.philosophicalEssence: The border between Air and Water. Strength and survival.
adventureThemes: Proving strength and survival
Never-ending battle

planes.name: Plane of Magma
planes.philosophicalEssence: The boundary between Earth and Fire. Creation through volcanic forces.
adventureThemes: Creation and volcanic forces

planes.name: Plane of Ooze
planes.philosophicalEssence: Contrast between stable earth and steadily flowing water. Objects cast here can't be found for at least a century.
adventureThemes: Objects lost for centuries
Seeking powerful Artifacts cast into the swamp
Braving monstrous insects and hags

planes.name: Positive Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Source of radiant energy and raw life force. A continual furnace of creation, a domain of brilliance.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Akin to the Elemental Plane of Air but every bit glows brightly. Dangerous to mortal forms. Only creatures with Immunity to Radiant damage can survive.

temperature.description: Like the heart of a star.

hazards.name: Overwhelming Radiance
hazards.description: Every bit of this plane glows brightly with innate power dangerous to mortal forms. Only creatures with Immunity to Radiant damage can survive.

adventureThemes: Vibrant life and creative energy
Lasting charge of energy making it hard to calm down or sleep
Persistent resistance to disease and despair after visiting

planes.name: Shadowfell
planes.philosophicalEssence: A gloomy dimension of gloom, death, and dread. Landmarks similar to Material Plane but distorted and sinister.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Melancholic atmosphere that can afflict characters with despair.

hazards.name: Shadowfell Despair
hazards.description: A melancholic atmosphere pervades the Shadowfell. Usually not more than once per day, a character not from the Shadowfell makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On failure, affected by despair (d6 table). New despair replaces old. Recovery: DC 15 Wisdom save after Long Rest. Calm Emotions or remove curses cures.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: When the DM deems appropriate, usually not more than once per day, a character not from the Shadowfell makes the save.

onFailure.description: The character is affected by despair. Roll d6: 1-3 Apathy (Disadvantage on Death Saves and Initiative), 4-5 Dread (Disadvantage on all saving throws), 6 Delusion (Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws using Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma).
onFailure.duration: Until DC 15 Wisdom save after Long Rest or Calm Emotions/remove curse magic

savingThrowToTraverse.recoveryTrigger: After finishing a Long Rest, a character can attempt DC 15 Wisdom saving throw to end the despair.
recoveryMethods: DC 15 Wisdom saving throw after Long Rest

notableEntities.name: Strahd von Zarovich
notableEntities.title: The First Vampire, Darklord of Barovia

notableEntities.name: Ivana Boritsi
notableEntities.title: Darklord of Borca
notableEntities.description: Vicious poisoner.

notableEntities.name: Ivan Dilisnya
notableEntities.title: Darklord of Borca
notableEntities.description: Childishly cruel stalker.

notableEntities.name: Vladeska Drakov
notableEntities.title: General, Darklord of Falkovnia
notableEntities.description: Commands fierce military force against endless zombie plague.

notableEntities.name: Doctor Viktra Mordenheim
notableEntities.title: Darklord of Lamordia
notableEntities.description: Inventor whose efforts to create life and abolish death led to tragedy.

notableEntities.name: Chakuna
notableEntities.title: Darklord of Valachan
notableEntities.description: Devious hunter who draws people into fatal contests.

domainsOrRegions.name: Barovia
domainsOrRegions.description: Towering spires of Castle Ravenloft loom above the valley.

domainsOrRegions.name: Borca
domainsOrRegions.description: Opulent estates and impoverished villages where two Darklords pursue obsessive schemes.

domainsOrRegions.name: Falkovnia
domainsOrRegions.description: Empty countryside and crumbling cities fighting a losing battle against endless zombie plague.

domainsOrRegions.name: Kalakeri
domainsOrRegions.description: Beautiful land of rainforests, rivers, and lakes where three monstrous royal heirs battle endlessly for the throne.

domainsOrRegions.name: Lamordia
domainsOrRegions.description: Frozen bogs and glacial expanses where inventors violate natural and moral laws.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mordent
domainsOrRegions.description: The realm of ghost stories and hauntings. Death heralds a haunted afterlife as a restless spirit.

domainsOrRegions.name: Valachan
domainsOrRegions.description: Jungles where a devious hunter draws people into fatal contests.

adventureThemes: Encounters with Undead
Explorations of distorted mirror-landscapes
Descents into mist-shrouded Domains of Dread
Horror and escape

crossReferences.description: Domains of Dread described in more detail.

planes.name: Sigil
planes.philosophicalEssence: A bustling planar metropolis of countless portals. A trader's paradise where goods and information come from across the planes.

physicalProperties.shape: A ring-shaped city floating above the Spire at the center of the Outlands. Structures built on the ring's inner surface.

notableEntities.name: Lady of Pain
notableEntities.title: Ruler of Sigil
notableEntities.description: An inscrutable being on par with deities. Wears ornate robes and a mantle of blades coated in blue-green verdigris around a masklike face. Purpose and goals unknown.

adventureThemes: Trade in goods and information from across the planes
Finding portal keys and commands
Item-keyed portals throughout the city

planes.name: Ysgard
planes.philosophicalEssence: Glory earned through heroic deeds in battle. Euphoria of athletics, exhilaration of storms, triumphant celebration of victory.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Charged with glory, heroic spirit, and the thrill of battle without permanent consequence.

temperature.description: Long hot summers and cold unforgiving winters.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Windswept. Long hot summers and cold unforgiving winters.

layers.name: Ysgard
layers.description: Immense rivers of floating earth grind together in eternal rumbling. Soaring mountains, deep fjords, and windswept battlefields.

notableLocations.name: Plain of Ida
notableLocations.description: Daily festivals where warriors and athletes show off their bravery and skill.

layers.name: Muspelheim
layers.description: The ground smokes and burns beneath the earthbergs of the top layer.

layers.name: Nidavellir
layers.description: Floating chunks of earth are closer together, giving the appearance of endless tunnels with rich mineral deposits.

resurrectionRule.requirement: Must be killed in combat while in Ysgard.

adventureThemes: Lighthearted combat without consequences
Proving mettle against epic foes
Daily festivals of warriors and athletes
Greater challenges in lower layers

globalPlanarConnections.name: Infinite Staircase
globalPlanarConnections.description: An extradimensional staircase connecting the planes. Entrance appears as a nondescript door leading to a landing with stairs up and down. Changes appearance as it climbs and descends. Includes ramps, hovering platforms, and clockwork conveyor belts. Doors often tucked in dusty, half-forgotten places.
hazards: Guarded by devas, sphinxes, yugoloths, and other powerful monsters

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Oceanus
globalPlanarConnections.description: Sweet and fragrant water originating in Thalasia (Elysium layer 4). Flows through each of Elysium's layers, through the top layer of the Beastlands, across the top layer of Arborea, and drains in Arborea's second layer. Trading vessels sail its length and small towns line its banks.

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Styx
globalPlanarConnections.description: Bubbles with grease, foul flotsam, and putrid remains. Churns through the top layers of seven Lower Planes with tributaries snaking through lower layers. Sinister ferries crewed by skilled pilots carry passengers between planes for a price.
hazards: Memory loss from touching the waters (see chapter 3)

globalPlanarConnections.name: Yggdrasil, the World Tree
globalPlanarConnections.description: A cosmic ash tree spanning the Outer Planes and linking them to many Material Plane worlds. Roots stretch into the Lower Planes (Hades, Pandemonium, possibly others). Most of its trunk rises through Ysgard. Branches stretch through Upper Planes and across the Astral to the Material Plane.
hazards: Ever-changing paths as tree continues eternal growth

bloodWar.description: Throughout history, the teeming demon hordes of the Abyss and the regimented legions of devils from the Nine Hells have battled for supremacy in the cosmos. The Blood War has raged for millennia, ravaging the Lower Planes. A moment never goes by when demons and devils aren't battling somewhere in the multiverse.

factions.name: Demons
factions.role: Teeming hordes of chaotic evil seeking to spread corruption and destruction.

factions.name: Devils
factions.role: Regimented legions of lawful evil seeking supremacy through order and law.

factions.name: Celestials and Angels
factions.role: Monitor and intervene when the Blood War spills outside the Abyss and Nine Hells, minimizing threat to the rest of the multiverse.

bloodWar.adventureImplications: Powerful mortal adventurers are sometimes drawn into tangled schemes by demons and devils seeking advantages. Open conflict between Fiends is a constant threat on most Lower Planes. Celestials and mortals of exceptional valor stand ready to intervene when it spills over.

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Portals
planarTravelMethods.description: Stationary interplanar connections linking specific locations. Can be doorways, locations existing on multiple planes, or vortices. Often have requirements (command, key item, random, situation, or time-based).
requirements: Meeting portal requirements (command word, key item, timing, situation)
risks: Requirements may be difficult to meet

planarTravelMethods.name: Spells
planarTravelMethods.description: Several spells allow direct or indirect access to different planes of existence with varying degrees of precision.
requirements: Material components (e.g. tuning fork for Plane Shift)

planarTravelMethods.name: The Dream of Other Worlds
planarTravelMethods.description: Aided by magic, travelers can fall into a deep slumber and dream themselves into a new realm.

planarTravelMethods.name: The Great Journey
planarTravelMethods.description: An epic voyage through Wildspace and across the Astral Plane aboard a vessel powered by magic, or through the Shadowfell or Feywild.

planarTravelMethods.name: The Leap to Another Realm
planarTravelMethods.description: Using spells such as Teleportation Circle or Teleport, or magical portals, to appear in a known location in another world.
requirements: Knowledge of destination teleportation circle or location

planarTravelMethods.name: The Roots of the Worlds
planarTravelMethods.description: Locations existing in multiple worlds simultaneously, often at or near the roots where seedlings of the First World's great tree took root. Can be geographical features or constructed places. Some flit between worlds on a schedule.
requirements: Possibly magic, an object from the destination, or act of will
risks: Schedule-dependent nexus points may carry travelers unexpectedly

infernalHierarchy.title: Duke/duchess
canDemoteTo: Any lesser or greater devil form

infernalHierarchy.title: Archduke/archduchess
canDemoteTo: Any lesser or greater devil form

planarAdventureSituations.situation: When magic fails to revive a dead person, the only solution is to venture to the Outer Planes to find the person's spirit and either release it from some prison or convince the person to return to life.

People who venture into the woods keep accidentally wandering into the Feywild or the Shadowfell. They might never return, return with no sense of how much time has passed, or return dramatically changed.
A long-dead oracle is the only one who knows how a terrible prophecy might be averted, but the cataclysmic fulfillment of the prophecy has already begun.
A god has stopped answering prayers and won't respond to any Commune spell.
A devil has tricked an angel into meddling in the Blood War, and the angel seeks mortal aid.
An ancestor of one of the characters must be convinced to bless the character before the full power of the character's bloodline can be unleashed.
A foolhardy knight carried a holy weapon on a doomed mission into the Nine Hells, and the powers of Mount Celestia want the weapon and the knight's remains retrieved.
A titan is imprisoned on an Outer Plane. The characters might be trying to stop those who seek to release it, or they might want to release it to help defend the world from a greater threat.

To prove themselves worthy of an even greater quest, the characters are sent to slay a horrible monster, win the favor of a powerful planar being, negotiate peace between two warring planar factions, or retrieve a long-lost item on another plane.
An item of legend is being sold at auction in Sigil, the City of Brass, or some other planar metropolis.

globalPlanarDissonance.description: Celestials who visit the Lower Planes and Fiends who visit the Upper Planes experience significant discomfort if their visits last more than a few hours. After finishing a Long Rest on a plane alien to its nature, a Celestial or Fiend makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save and ends when the creature finishes a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to the creature's nature.

onFailure.description: Whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: The effect is cumulative with each failed save. Each additional failure adds another 1d4 subtracted from D20 Tests.

recoveryMethods: Finish a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to the creature's nature

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
